resources.string: You don\'t have any registered devices yet.\n Let\'s get started.
No internet connection.\nPlease check your WiFi.

Interact with your device via FlowCloud
Username must be longer than 5 characters
Not http, nor https protocol of URL

You can use the MakeItFlow app to connect your device to the FlowCloud platform from your smartphone or tablet. Once connected, you will then be able to manage any devices that are registered to your FlowCloud account.

MakeItFlow, the MakeItFlow logo, FlowCloud, the FlowCloud logo, Imagination Technologies, and the Imagination Technologies logo are trademarks or registered trademarks of Imagination Technologies Limited.
All other product names are trademarks of their respective companies.

You can use the MakeItFlow app to connect any supported devices to the FlowCloud platform from your smartphone or tablet. Once connected, you will then be able to use the app to manage any supported devices that are registered to your FlowCloud account.
Wi•Fire board has two modes, Wi-Fi connected and Wi-Fi setup.
Wi-Fi setup mode is used to configure the Wi•Fire board from the MakeITFlow app so that it can communicate with FlowCloud. Your Wi•Fire board should be shipped from the factory in Wi-Fi setup mode.
Wi-Fi connected mode is used by Wi•Fire board to communicate with other devices using FlowCloud.
2. Tap Setup a device from the list of options.
3. Follow the prompts on the screen to connect the Wi•Fire board to your network.

Note: You can find the password for your Wi•Fire board on the inside of Wi•Fire\'s box. If you can\'t find the password on the box, you can find out the password by entering the show wifire_details command in the CLI (see the Command Line Interface help topic on the FlowCloud website for more information on using the CLI).
To find out how to use your board after it has been set up, visit our website:

Your Wi•Fire board communicates with FlowCloud over the internet, via a wireless access point (WAP) or router. Once connected to FlowCloud, you can use the MakeItFlow app to interact with Wi•Fire board when developing applications.

Note: To interact with your Wi•Fire board using the MakeItFlow app, your Wi•Fire board needs to be in Wi-Fi connected mode. Wi•Fire board automatically enters Wi-Fi connected mode after you have successfully completed the setup process.

You can confirm your Wi•Fire board is connected to FlowCloud by checking LD4 on the board. LD4 on the Wi•Fire board will start flashing while trying to connect to FlowCloud. When a connection to FlowCloud has been established, LD4 on the Wi•Fire board will stop flashing and remain steady.
Selecting a Wi•Fire board to interact with
The Connected devices screen displays all boards registered to you that have successfully connected to FlowCloud.
To interact with one of your connected Wi•Fire boards:
3. Select your Wi•Fire board from the list.
4. Tap the Interact with selected button.
Running a test to confirm that Wi•Fire board is in Wi-Fi connected mode
Carry out the following to check that you can send commands to Wi•Fire board using your Android or iOS device:
1. Enter or select the command that you want to send to Wi•Fire board from the top of the screen.
3. Check the output to verify that your Wi•Fire board can receive commands from your Android or iOS device.
Switching between Wi-Fi setup and Wi-Fi connected mode
